reviews.sentence: I came just prior to a big icestorm in March. I did not leave the hotel for a day and a half. The staff were always very courteous to me and helped make my stay pleasant. They even gave me free internet for my time there. The pool and whirlpool were heated but outdoors so I was not able to enjoy them. I was able to enjoy free internet due to their courtesy however normally it would be a costly item. I feel it is a ploy to have to pay for a service that is free most places.
I loved the lobby staff and room. I would stay here again and recommend. The hot tub was very nice. The pool was described as heated 12 months a year and it was ice cold.

Updated older building. Loved the view from our room. The executive upgrade was definitely worth it as it included breakfast. Elevator was very fast. A lot of noise from the pool area seemed to filter in through the windows also noise in the walnot sure what is was. An in room refrigerator would have been nice.

Memorial Day Weekend Holiday Stay. Located East Memphis about 15 20 minutes downtown and Graceland Spacious lobby yet at times crowded especially in the evenings with guests at the lobby bar guests using the free WiFi in room WiFi charge applicable and visitors attending events in the balroms Self parking which is free and monitored each night with a security guard in a golf cart. No need to valet since the self parking lot is adjacent to the valet lot. Check in was quick and easy. Kudos to front desk staff with checking in guests quickly Rooms were modern clean and stocked with essentials. Recommend a room facing north east away from the noise of the highway interstateBathrom restroom were uncomfortable bath tub and toilet placed in a small rom Pool and hot tub were dirty leaves and branches floating. It did not look like the pool or hot tub were cleaned during my 3 night stay. As well towels were limited or non existent. Receipt invoice was not delivered therefore physical check out had to be done at the front desk rather than express checkout leaving room card in the room. Invoice included County Tax and City Tax on top of the Room Sales Tax. I do not recall paying 3 taxes on top of the room cost at any other hotel. I recommend this hotel based on the location easy access to the interstate nearby TripAdivisor recommended restaurants such as Corkys Gus Fried Chicken and Blue Plate Cafe.

The hotel says heated pool it is not. The whirlpool did not work although it was hot. The food was overpriced and not tasty. No free wi fi. The TV had a fuzzy picture. The toilet would run for 10 mins after being flushed. They tried to charge us 450 for a bottle of water we did not drink. Will not stay here again but would love to visit Memphis again.

Soccer Tournament Visit. Huge hotel but hard to get in and out of from the freeway. Beautiful lobby and staff was friendly at check in. Bar in lobby was nice with friendly staff. Inside hotel it is hard to find things signs to pool are non existent. Overall room was ok but seemed to slant to the outside. The elevators were scary creaked and popped when you were on them. Older hotel but only one that could handle 4 teams of soccer players. There was a prom there that weekend and it was covered up with party people but we did not hear them just heard people above us which was a little weird. Breakfast was buffet in the restaurant and the staff were very very nice in the restaurant.

Nice hotel. We had a nice 1 night stay. The staff was friendly the room was clean and there was plenty of parking. We also had a free breakfast buffet the morning we left. The only reason I did not give it 5 stars is because the pool area had duck poop and the water had quite a bit of hair in it. We were there right before it closed that night and I saw them cleaning the next morning so I am sure it is nt that way too often.

Location The rooms are niceParking too far to walk there security guys run around a little golf carts they could give them larger cards and give customers rinds up to the hotel from the parking lot. As usual the gym could be much better pool windows are always dirty.

Lazy employees and nasty pool. At first glance this hotel looked awesome from the outside. Man who checked us in was nice but forgot to tell us which floor our room was on. Nasty dirty plates were in front of our door I guess room service from previous room or next door. I pushed it aside to the hallway. I was so excited about getting some pool time until I had a closer look DIRTY. The tray with plates never got picked up when we checked out. Laziness. We will never return.

Lazy employees and nasty pool. At first glance this hotel looked awesome from the outside. Man who checked us in was nice but forgot to tell us which floor our room was on. Nasty dirty plates were in front of our door I guess room service from previous room or next door. I pushed it aside to the hallway. I was so excited about getting some pool time until I had a closer look DIRTY. The tray with plates never got picked up when we checked out. Laziness. We will never return.

Nice stay. Good hotel in good location. Wifi is not free unles you are a member of its loyalty program. The hotel is a bit worn and probably can use a remodeling update. The fitness facility is very nice looked like it is recently remodeled with dumbbells up to 50 lbs cable cross treadmills elliptical bikes exercise balls stretch area and leg press machine. It faces the swimming pool outside.

Room called Eagles nest. It was an amazing experience to stay on a room penthouse thanks to the adorable front desk clerk she asked me did you ever stay on the top floor of a hotel. I said not yet and voilá we got this great room with an impressive view. Clean quiet a little trouble for those who can not deal with stairs lonce as you leave the elevator area you have to climb 6 steps to your room but no big deal for us. Pool was clean and jacuzi was air jets a little noise but who cares when you are on vacation right. Service at the restaurant was great.

One of the best in Memphis. Safe area nice views everything is clean from the rooms to the pool and hot tub. Friendly and helpful staff. I only had a one night stay so I did not get to maximize everything they had to offer. But I am sure that if my stay was longer this review would be even more favorable.

very good hotel to stay at in memphis. great service by all staff members. nice view from our room of the pool. good breakfast and very attentive wait staff. very pleasant and quick when using the bell service. overall we loved the experience.
friendly hotel bit expensive. staff friendly very helpful pool came in useful on hot daysfod drink on the expensive side.

Pleasant hotel surrounded with nice landscape. The first room assigned for us was noisy facing roof fans over lobby. Changed room to opposite side which was quieter. Large lobby is nice but somewhat outdated design. Lots of hard surface and noisy. Surrounding pool with geese are pleasant to watch and relaxing. Shower water pressure was very weak. Surrounding landscape. A Japanese restaurant SEKISUI is nearby 5 minutes drive and food was excellent. Downtown Beale street the most fun spot with great music and food. Upgrade public space. Hire interior designer with better taste. Improve shower. Plant green shrub surrounding gazebo by the pond. Play better music.
Great. Really nice pool super nice room the food and drinks were great. Plenty of taxi service to get you downtown.
Awesome stay. My room was nice and clean the hotel is a little old on the inside. I loved the pool and hot tub.
Hilton hotel in Memphis. Clean very nice people here at the hotelBig nigger party at the pool did not get to enjoy the pool with my kids.

Excellent Memphis hotel. This hotel had everything you need pool snack bar bar clean rooms computers in the lobby. I loved the fact that it had a pool that ducks could swim in. Also the views from every room were awesome we watched the sunset.

Okay stay. Room was nice but definitely could use improvements. The room was great. There is a bar downstairs and a Starbucks. Pool and hot tub are outside and the weather was decent so that was nice. Bed was comfy and loved the Keurig in the room but could use better creamer. Check in was not smooth. We were told by Hiltoncom that our room was paid for but got there and found out it was not. The manager was not very helpful nor very nice. there is construction so lots of noise. There was also a kids birthday party so the pool was over run by kids and it was LOUD. The Starbucks person left the cafe and the guy who was there alone did not know how to make a drink so I waited about 10 minutes before I could order anything. He also could not work the register so that was fun. The doors to the rooms are literally side by side and tucked into an alcove so it is like you are roommates with strangers. SUPER awkward when you are coming or going from your room and so are they. there is barely enough room for you both to walk out.
